projects.title: COLOR PROCESSOR
what: Scan existing fabrics.
Read and modify scanned texture data.
Grayscale and use as base material for PBR.
Scanned textures inputted into a database.
why: Automation tool, converts to grayscale to easily create various textures.
Easy color manipulation based on default gray image.
Reduce need to send packages back and forth.
how: Scan the texture with VIZIO.
Grayscale textures on GPU using EmguCV.
Hook into scanner and output to database.
Generate Scriptable object and store data.

projects.title: DEPUTY DONUT
what: Couch co-op game where you play as either an officer or a donut truck.
The truck ran off without giving the officer his order! Battle the truck as the officer or defend yourself as the truck driver.
how: Technical artist.
Creation of 3D meshes and rigging.
4 programmers and an artist.
weekly report group project.

projects.title: METADATA HIDER
what: A tool that takes the unity-generated meta files and hides / unhides them.
why: Declutters the Windows file browser from unity Generated meta files.
how: Search the directories specified for meta files
Rescan for files on changes in one of the directories
Request the internal information of the file from Windows
Modify the file's flags to hide it.
Keep track of the files that are hidden.
Files can be specified to be ignored.

projects.title: NODE EDITOR
what: A node editor that makes it possible to create a state machine.
Custom graphs are more versatile and allow full customization and events, while leaving out reliance on Unity for the logic.
Functional, Conditional and Text nodes.
why: Narrative builder for everyone to use, not just developers.
Working together with people without a need for coding experience.
Easily setting up a connective graph and different languages.

projects.title: WORLD CARER
what: Extra Credits Game Jam project, theme: 'TAKE CARE'.
First game-jam experience, I had a great time!
Protect the earth from incoming asteroid fire by creating shields around the sections.
how: Joint effort of another programmer and me.
Focus on user controls, UI, The asteroid spawning and the score system.
Fuly customizable settings and stored between sessions.

projects.title: AI-SURVIVAL
what: Learning various AI behaviours and interactions.
Create an AI to survive against zombies roaming the map while scavenging and mapping out the area.
how: Custom C++ framework
Finite State Machine and Behaviour Tree.
Implementing various steering behaviours; seeking, wandering, fleeing, shooting...
Behaviours coded within state machines and self-contained within the auto-player.

Set up frame events with C# jobs.
Animation events & controller.
Customizable animation speed.
why: Easily add and modify animation data.
Easy setup from editor window from spritesheet.
how: DOTS based individual sprite animation.
Replace all unity events with tasks.
Odin Inspector data serializer.

projects.title: ITEM DATABASE

Set up components and crafting recipes.
Add Actions to items without UnityEvents.
Add relevant data for the item in editor.
Lootable chests and drop tables.

projects.title: MASTER OF TILES
what: Ludum Dare 47, theme: 'STUCK IN A LOOP'.
Press the button to unlock a door and build up the soundtrack.
Every button press adds to the soundtrack which loops on itself.
Complete the loop to reset the music and play again.
(expansion plans to add more depth to the music when the loop finishes)
how: Creating tools for people unfamiliar with Unity
World and tile generator for the levels (expandable)
Audio system with full parametric control of all settings accessible through Unity.
Audio manager that creates, manages and disposes sound sources when necessary (cached)
